Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire V5-471P-6498 14-Inch Touchscreen Laptop (Silky Silver)
Reviews.Author: Navin Goyal
Reviews.Content: The laptop is pretty decent. Backlit keyboard is cool but feels a little delicate..not a big deal though. Had issues with the wifi connection dropping randomly but uninstalled the driver and installed newer driver from Acer's website (Please see that if you check the driver already installed it says the driver is up to date. But there is another latest driver on Acer website. So you will need to manually uninstall the current driver and install the newer driver). No more issues with the wifi dropping so far. Got a nice deal from Amazon. The speakers are great. Need to get used to Windows 8. Touchscreen is nice. The battery lasts about 4-4.5 hrs. Laptop is sleek and looks fancy. Touchpad is not upto the mark, but again that's not a deal breaker. Some people complained of fan noise on similar model series, but it was minimal and unnoticeable. Will definitely recommend this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Slow but fixable
Reviews.Author: D. Larson "4reel"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer mostly for wifi use and traveling. When I first tried it slow would have been to kind of a word. Windows 8 was another issue but that is training more that a problem. I brought up the task manager, ctrl, alt, del and watched the resource meter. Symantec was eating more than 50% of the resources and even more during an update. I removed Symantec and installed Kaspersky instead and it made a huge difference. I installed Classic Start 8, which s free and the computer now works as I hoped it would. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: Worth it!
Reviews.Author: Chaman
Reviews.Content: I bought the machine after extensive research and did so even with some reviewers mentioning the wifi issues. I got my moneys worth. After the upgrade from Acers website, I have had no problems with the wifi connection.Let me start with the Cons, because there are so few:1. The graphics display is not exceptional. But good for most uses.2. All the USB ports are on the left side. It would've been nice if they put one on the right side.3. The LAN connection requires a provided adapter. It might be a hassle carrying it around.That is all I have for the issues.Pros:1. Fast for normal use. i5 is sufficient for most everyday purposes.2. keyboard is nice - and the backlight is good.3. Touchscreen works well. I have had no problems with it so far - and windows 8, though with its own problems, is not as bad as a lot of the reviews say.4. comes with 4GB ram in 1 of 4 slots. I am going to purchase another 4 GB to make sure I don't get slowed down with the number of applications I have running.5. Quite light. The battery is tiny.There may be more things I like about this machine - the best thing is the price - around $550.For that price, this machine is a steal. I have a few other Acer machines, and they are all working fine. Good job on this one Acer!!

Reviews.Title: Strong laptop for price. Great bang for buck.
Reviews.Author: Nick Z
Reviews.Content: Where do I start...  -CPU- The dual-core i5-3337U is clocked at 1.8GHz (which is a little low, but ok for laptops.), which is normally nothing to brag about. BUT it overclocks itself to an insane 2.6GHz when needed. On top of it, the dual-core is hyperthreaded. This means the processor has 2 threads per core, which means it has double the multitasking power of an equivalent Pentium or AMD.  -Graphics/Gaming- As a hardcore desktop-gaming fan, I was skeptical what this could do. I was a little surprised though. The HD Graphics 4000 won't move heaven and earth, heck it won't even feel speedy, but it runs all 2D gaming wonderfully. However, 3D gaming is where you have to compromise. Most top-tier games past 2011 won't run well (25fps or so at 1024x576 resolution across a plethora of titles). However, some games pre-2010 can run pretty well. I was able to get a solid 35FPS on Counter-Strike:Source with all graphics on high (except AA) and at full resolution. Minecraft blew me away, with 30-50FPS on Far render distance and all graphics up all the way (you will drop to 10-20FPS on some of the big-friggin' servers with same graphics, beware. Lower your setting and you'll be fine). I believe the i5 is what really helps this guy during gaming, the 2.6GHz really makes the GPU the bottleneck.  -RAM- Mine came with a 4GB stick running at a nice 1600MHz. Surprisingly, this laptop has FOUR SODIMM slots for RAM. FOUR. So if you really wanted to, you could put in up to 16GB of RAM. 8GB is all you need, though. You can easily oipen the RAM back panel and place in 3 more sticks.  -HDD- The hard drive is your everyday typical 5400rpm 500GB drive. Not super fast, but stays very quiet, almost inaudible. The speed ain't crazy amazing (at least 10+MB/s when copying locally), but then again your buying a $550 laptop. You can only really hear it if you put your ear to the chassis of the laptop. I am not sure if you can replace the drive by yourself, but I'm sure any laptop repair place can put one in for you.  -Audibility- This laptop is quiet. The hard drive is practically silent, and the fan can only become distracting when the laptop is under heavy load (aka gaming)  -Keyboard-  The keyboard is nice enough for a laptop. It's solid and the keys feel secure. However, it isn't exactly a pleasure to type on it like a Lenovo, but it isn't bad either. It's just kinda... normal.  -Display- The 1378x768 touchscreen is very nice for a laptop. At times is almost feels like I'm working on a tablet. The 14" display is the great size; not tiny but things are not blurry for the resolution. It can get nice and bright during day (on max setting) but is a little too bright during night on lowest setting.  -I/O- It has 2 USB 2.0 and only 1 USB 3.0, along with an HDMI, Display port, and ships with an external Display port-to-Ethernet and VGA converter. The optical drive is well... an optical drive. You can't really go more in depth than there.  -Battery- I can barely squeeze a solid 3.5-4 hours of life with general browsing and some mild battery saving-management. I get around 1.25 hours when gaming off-charger.*EDIT*- With gaming, you can squeeze more around 1.5-1.75 hours out of the battery.  -Chassis- This is a bit subjective, but the plastic chassis feels pretty solid and sleek. It's light and portable.Over all, this laptop is a steal for the price.

Reviews.Title: Can't be beat at a $500 price point. Upgradable, thin and light. 3rd gen I5
Reviews.Author: L.N.
Reviews.Content: Pros:Very easy to upgrade RAM (up to 16gb, 4gb 1600Mhz/12800 comes pre-installed)I5 dual core 3rd gen.Touchscreen makes Win8 much more tolerable and increases it's functionality with respect to "Apps"Very light weight and thin.Comes with an adapter to use VGA and 10/100 Ethernet. besides two USB 2.0 ports and one USB3.0 port, HDMI, SD cardChassis is made from what is seemingly an aluminum alloy which compared to plastic, is much more durable and the seems aren't exposed and likely to break apart like some many plastic chassis have or will.At fourteen inches, the screen and laptop are considerably easier to work withcompared to 15.6" laptopsStays cool to the touch under normal operating conditions.Well vented.Cons:Pre-loaded bloatwareIn order to maintain a wifi signal, the driver must be updated via the driver found on the website for the wireless adapter.Graphics = poor / 4000HDD can be upgraded as well however the one that comes preinstalled runs at 5400rpm and performs as if it were in a machine constructed 10 years ago.Touchpad sensitivity is poor and even when adjusted, has a mind of it's own sometimes.Battery life is surprisingly short even with advanced power saving features.Final thought:For $500 you would be hard pressed to beat the specs and performance of this machine.For an additional $150. you can upgrade the RAM and install a SSD which would make this more comparable to machines that cost in excess of $800+**If you choose this laptop, include with it, a screen protector with the order. The screen if left unprotected, will be covered in very noticeable smudges and finger prints.This is not by any means a gaming PC unless you're interested in touch based simple apps (angry birds, etc)"Silky Silver" = brushed aluminum alloy.

Reviews.Author: C. Labajo "C0526"
Reviews.Content: I am actually using this laptop right now while typing this! haha wow!Anyways, it's a very nice laptop! I wanted to get a MacBook Pro but I heard Mac's don't really acquire Java & most of the students have a struggle on that. THIS ONE ROCKS! reminds me alot of Macbook pro! I fell inlove with this laptop! I was all inlove for months now! Still inlove until now! Very fast! No worries at all! Trust me, you're not gonna regret getting this laptop. okay? don't believe other people here saying it's a bad laptop cause to be honest, this laptop rocks!The only thing I don't like is the speakers! It's at the bottom & it's slow unless you put it up high then it gets better. No problems anyways cause I always use speakers so no problem. Reviews.Title: Very good laptop.
Reviews.Author: detmemar
Reviews.Content: I've owned this laptop now for about six weeks, and I'm not having any issues.  Windows 8 and a touchscreen laptop have been a bit of a learning curve for me, but I'm getting along fine.  I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nice notebook, not an excellent one
Reviews.Author: P. R. B. Barbosa "ECGAR"
Reviews.Content: Peace and blessings!.I had made some research before purchasing this notebook. My previous notebook was a HP 1030-US 14".The reasons that made me choose this one have been:Acer brand,Costumers rating and reviews,Core i5,14 inches touchscreen,Lightweight;Backlit keyboard;Bluetooth 4.0 and USB 3.0, andPrice;After working around with it for about two weeks, I can share the following:Pros:Looks sleek,Third generation Core i5 is Ok.The fan is very silent,It has not warmed the downside cover at all, and I can use on my lap,Touchscreen is responsive and accurate, and the screen seems always clean after use. Therefore, it is not a strong finger print magnet. Point to Acer.Windows 8 is tricky and I had to familiarize with it. After some training, Windows 8 turned out to be interesting.Keyboard is backlit and lights on as I type any key, and lights off when not in use. It has also a command to turn lights off permanently. This is a good facility and allows me to spare battery.The track pad is sensitive, and has a command to enable and disable it.The notebook has a light DVD player and recorder, although I seldom use it.It comes with Office 365 and Mcafee anti-virus pre-installed (trial versions).Cons:During regular use, which means, Wifi on, screen brightness in the lowest setting, surfing the web, downloading files, battery life will NOT last for more than three hours! Once I disabled Wifi and set it to plane mode, turned off keyboard lights, dimmed screen to lowest possible brightness, also disable a sort of memory boot setting (You can look for informations about this setting in the manual), and just used for tying on MS Word, the battery dropped from 75% to 20% in three hours. Therefore, I estimate it may last up to five, maybe six, hours if fully charged, and in the same restrictive conditions of use as the later above.The keyboard is not very comfortable, as compared to other brands. Often, I have to type twice the same key to have the letter or space typed, as I write this review, for instance. Sometimes, I hit once and it types twice the same letter as, for instance, when I type the letter `a`. This is annoying!The track pad is slightly displaced to the left of the center of the keyboard. This positioning makes me often find the right border of the track pad instead of its center, which makes Windows 8 menu to appear. Again, this is quite annoying.Although fast, USB 3.0 is not as fast as the one in my previous notebook.Original boot up time had been longer when compared to other brands, like ASUS. From pressing the on button, it had taken up to 30 sec to get to the password screen. It had also taken about the same time to complete shut down. Because of that, I decided to increase RAM to eight gigabytes and replace hard disk with a SSD Sandisk Ultra 256. Hard disk replacement was very tricky, and required much attention, but I could do it successfully. To do so, I watched a tutorial in Youtube on how to tear down ACER, which was very instructive. Now, the notebook boots in less 10 sec, and shuts down in about 15 sec.Overall, I gave it four stars.I shall update this revision in a near future.Update: Feb 22nd, 2014I have noticed that the keys of the keyboard are somewhat loose on their places, which may be responsible for the lack of sensitivity when typing. Also, only when I press the center of the space bar, not its corners, is a space inserted in a document.Update: March 7th, 2014The keyboard seems to be much more flawed than I thought at first.The keys seem to be loose on the keyboard. I cannot always print a character on the first keystroke. I often have to type a key more than once for the character to be printed. And at other moments, for a reason unknown to me, when typing once the character is printed twice. This is the most uncomfortable aspect of this computer so far. I am not sure whether this an incident problem on this particular machine I have purchased (lucky me) or a problem also shared by other costumers. I would appreciate if Acer technical assistance could help in fixing this keyboard issue. Peace and blessings.

Reviews.Title: Everything I need!
Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: I just started a hybrid (online and face-to-face) accelerated nursing program which utilizes A LOT of different programs/applications...etc. This laptop works effortlessly to run everything I need to be successful. I spent a good month of solid researching to find what I needed and this laptop fit the bill.I had financial constraints and hoped to keep the cost ~500, but I was willing to spend a little more knowing this would be an investment- meaning I would own this laptop for years to come. I previously owned a netbook, but obviously that didn't have the kind of processing power that I would need. Then before that, my laptop was a 10 pounder from 2005. I love that this laptop has the Intel Core i5 processor, and the opportunity to expand the memory. I plan to expand later to help with speed, but I don't find any issues with speed as of now.Portability was also key for me because I need to lug my laptop around for clinicals and class day to day. I could easily get a cheaper laptop that would weigh more or less depending on specs, but with all the features (i5 processor, optical drive, touchscreen, 14') this laptop definitely offers most bang for the buck. This laptop is pretty thin and lightweight (<5lbs) and definitely not bulky. I've already had a few classmates who purchased new laptops for the program ask me about my laptop because it looks so sleek and light in comparison to theirs which fit the same specs as required by the program.Finally, I wanted touchscreen because I've heard it works best when using Windows 8, especially for the first time. I figured the touchscreen would give me a leg up in learning the new operating system and perhaps save me time. It's awesome!Great buy, great specs. I love this laptop! No issues thus far....EXCEPT when touching the screen in a text box area the "onscreen keyboard" pops up....THAT is annoying. I don't think that's a laptop issue so much as a Windows8 issue, but I could be wrong. I would prefer to disable the onscreen keyboard since I never use it...but I haven't quite figured out how to do that. It's not like you can detach the screen and turn it into a tablet...so I'm not sure why it pops up. Anywho....VERY happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: All good!!
Reviews.Author: Selena Tay
Reviews.Content: The laptop arrived in good condition, easy to install and works well, I bought for my 17 year old boy to replace his old laptop. We love the touch screen, looks slick and beautiful. Great product.

Reviews.Title: Enjoying This One A LOT
Reviews.Author: Mary Lee "Dinnerandamurder.com"
Reviews.Content: I am really enjoying this computer. We had purchased one previously that I could not see the keys on the keyboard and Amazon was nice enough to let me return it and purchase this one. It is so much easier to see the backlit keyboard with the added ability of upgrading the ram, which I will be doing shortly, as I seem to be pushing it to max too often. I got rid of the bloatware of which there is way too much of on this thing and the reason I did remove a star. Windows 8 is okay, but I find myself working mostly in desktop mode and installed a Windows 7 menu for ease of use. Windows 8 apps are not intuitive for closing and moving around. They are a bit of a pain in the patuty actually! So it's there, but I just don't much use it and can see the reason for so many of the complaints. But that is not the fault of this computer, which runs great. The screen contrast isn't very good compared to my other computers and can find no way to adjust that. It looks a little washed out, but I can live with it. I have dove into my settings and can find none that would change that any better. Yes, I am at max resolution and adjusted brightness. Its still not the best screen. It could just be mine, but I can live with it. Overall, for the price, it’s a good computer though.

Reviews.Title: tweak it and enjoy
Reviews.Author: Lori L. McManaman
Reviews.Content: Love it great machine.  Uninstalled bloat, games and antivirus I didn't want, next downloaded most of the updates for windows 8, then upgraded to windows 8.1.  Not sure what all the fuss is over 8.1, 8.1 is fairly intuitive, easy to learn, and speedy and honestly dare I say it, fun.  500 gig hard drive, with all but one program to add for video editing, over 400 gigs still available.  Backlit keyboard awesome.  Someday I will be expand the ram, only because I can, but out of the box with these few tweaks, I have a clean computer my kids are jelly of.bottom line, great product Acer, my now favorite laptop manufacturer

Reviews.Title: Wi fi problems fixed
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Everything is great with Acer except with Wi-Fi it continues to lose contact and I have no problem with any other device I have  (iPod touch roku and kindle fire) Those that complain about windows 8 I can't understand it gives a great touch experience  I will call Acer about Wi-Fi and hope they can correct this then I would give another star maybe two.Went to Acer website and downloaded driver update. No problems at all and have been on Internet for hours. With that solved I can honestly say this is better than my Asus all in one with Windows 7.

Reviews.Title: Touchy Touch Pad
Reviews.Author: Richard Harris
Reviews.Content: I saw all the other reviews and recommendations for reloading the wifi driver and accomplished that no problem and have had no problem with connectivity with my router. On the other hand, the touch pad is WAY TOO TOUCHY! and is large enough to be around my hands no matter what I'm doing on the PC typing. For example, while I've been typing this response, the screen has been jumping all over the place and jumped to the START screen before I could push the ESC key.I placed two calling cards on either end of the pad, but that has only been partially successful in keeping the touch pad deadened to my touch.I really like the computer, but will find a way to deaden the touch pad more to keep it.

Reviews.Title: Light, Sleek but slow.
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Becerra
Reviews.Content: Pros: Light, Sleek, Fast start-upCons: Difficult to find a fitted case for it, really slow with office products, slow in loading programs, battery life, difficult to connect to the internetIssues: Sometimes it will start scrolling down on it's own and it won't stop until I press Ctrl Atl Del. A few times the keyboard wouldn't work and I'd have to use the touch screen, after using it for a month the H button no longer lights up.It's a really nice laptop. I think I would like it even better had I not gotten Windows 8.The laptop has a few glitches. It might just be mine so I'm going to send it back to see if they can fix it.

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire 14" touchscreen laptop
Reviews.Author: Carine Manigat
Reviews.Content: This is lightweight and easy to navigate.  I use it for my personal use & I love it.  I recommend this item.

Reviews.Title: windows 8
Reviews.Author: simon eggeraat
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 is the worst operating system ever. Hard used hard to navigate not user friendly at all.Would not recommend any computer that is running Windows 8. Get seven it's better.

Reviews.Title: A good choice one!
Reviews.Author: Nyi Nyi
Reviews.Content: Slim and elegant but a but heavy.Internet connection is a bit problem.But I like It.It is worth the price!

Reviews.Title: excellent laptop....
Reviews.Author: Dominic
Reviews.Content: No issues with laptop, had it out of box and running in 5mins..excellent quality and features...was impressed it came for such a low price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent option within its range!
Reviews.Author: El Libertador
Reviews.Content: Great computer and price as well! Perfect combination. Very happy with my laptop and what it includes for both hardware and software.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Danny Collazo
Reviews.Content: Really nice smooth computer only thing would have to wrap so wont get scratch easy or if u take good care if ur things u b alright comes with a cloth sleeve for that also

Reviews.Title: I would recommend Acer Aspire V5-471P-6498...
Reviews.Author: Tosh Mitsuya
Reviews.Content: The price on this unit has been fluctuating. I paid $520.00.So far it has been reliable and easy to use.It is durable for office work.I like the back lit keyboard, and functionally I have no keyboard complaints.The touch screen and pad is a matter of getting use to like a new car.And the quality of the video image? I have seen worse and I have had better.I would say the video on this unit just makes it. If it were even a bit less I would have sent it back.So I laud the engineers at Acer for designing a keeper at this price.Windows 8 is what it is. I just create a Windows 7 like desktop and stay there.If Acer had a 13" version of this model and lighter I would have taken that.Battery life is ok, nothing to rave about. You have some control over the battery charging intervalby choosing the default video quality but I leave mine at the highest video quality.Have a nice day.

Reviews.Title: Awesome computer great for the price
Reviews.Author: david grigsby
Reviews.Content: When I bought this computer for 500$ I expected to get a slow laptop that is very thick. When ever I got it, it was very fast and looks very sleek. This was an amazing buy and I would recommend it to everybody. The one thing I don't like about it is it drops the internet connection a lot. The backlight keyboard and touch screen is very nice. The battery life is around two to three hours and something they can improve on. all and all I would highly recommend this to everybody.

Reviews.Title: Tremendous Bargain
Reviews.Author: John E. Ferguson "fergy"
Reviews.Content: I will not get into tech details as there is quite enough out there. Purchased the Acer Aspire 14 inch touchscreen refurbished through Amazon subsidiary. Shipped within five days even though advertised time was two weeks. Product appears brand new, not a mark on it. Set up was a breeze. Have had none of the wifi problems others have and wonder if this may be the result of being refurbished, it may simply have all the current downloads. Love the backlit keyboard, can work in the dark, no need to turn on lights, very handy when in a motel and the wife wants to go to sleep and I want to play. Keyboard feels just fine. Screen looks great and appears to be much faster than my five year old HP. Had a 17.3 inch that was just too big to take on vacations. This Acer is perfect. Have downloaded photos to an old photoshop program I had stored at Amazon, works like a charm. Connects to wifi rapidly and as earlier stated without interruption. Paid $409.00 refurbished and feel I got a steal.

Reviews.Title: Totally worth it
Reviews.Author: Rigo Chow
Reviews.Content: I had a previous good experience with a refurbished laptop (Dell Latitude) a few years ago so i decided to try again since it was a good price and it included the touchscreen feature. I only use it for basic stuff like writing docs, web browsing and video streaming so it was a good investment.The only 'but' so far is that sometimes the touchscreen becomes non-responsive when a website is loading. Perhaps it has something to do with the web browser flash plug-in (i use Firefox and Opera). I am still working on the troubleshooting so it could turn out to be something more simple after all. Is just that i have a Dell Latitude (not refurbished, also duo core i5, same programs, but in Win7) at work and it doesn't have this issue.Anyways i think the product is worth it.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Happy
Reviews.Author: Jacque
Reviews.Content: Great laptop for the price. I bought it when it was at $550. You get intel i5, touchscreen, and windows 8 (hard to adjust to). It even has a back lit keyboard!  Quite surprising in a budget laptop. It's around 4.5 lb, which is heavy but expected with a dvd drive. Beware though that this laptop may come with wifi problems, but thankfully a simple driver update from the Acer website seems to solve the problem. For $500-$550 I think you're getting a deal.I only wish I had waited for the price dropping even farther! Every dollar counts when you've got a lot of expenses coming your way D:.

Reviews.Title: Wifi doesn't work. Reinstalling the driver doesn't help.
Reviews.Author: s2077
Reviews.Content: Uninstalling and reinstalling the wifi driver does not always work. Many people have been complaining about the unreliable wifi on the Acer forums: [...]However, it doesn't seem like Acer is going to do anything about it.

Reviews.Title: Bad deal for BU student
Reviews.Author: Theresa L. Kraft
Reviews.Content: This didn't go well for my daughter at all.  For a student with a highly demanding schedule, we were so disappointed that she had to live without a computer until things were sorted out.  I'll have to ask her, again, exactly what when wrong, but it was bad.

Reviews.Title: OK laptop
Reviews.Author: Bunny Johnston
Reviews.Content: I hate Windows 8. There are a lot of programs that are incompatible with that and IE11.  Love the touchscreen. Took awhile to get used to. The laptop, itself was a good value.

Reviews.Title: This laptop is great!
Reviews.Author: lc21
Reviews.Content: The price was good for ths quality of laptop. 14 in. is the standard and the resolution is good enough. It is light and quiet, but still need some time with the touch screen. didn't see a problem yet, but you can't be sure since it's still new ( bought 4 weeks ago). For now, I'll say it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: She's happy, I'm happy!
Reviews.Author: cdubya
Reviews.Content: The Acer was purchased for my wife who just entered grad school. So far I have not heard any complaints. I take that to mean that the Acer met her expectation: mobility, lightweight, compact, performance, long battery life and so far so good, dependability.If she's happy, I'm happy!

Reviews.Title: Good laptop with a nice design
Reviews.Author: Lais
Reviews.Content: I was hoping for a nice pc not so high tech which I could just do my work and I've found it. It's a beautiful laptop, the keyboard and the touchscreen works pretty well. I also don't need a large memory for doing my stuff so it seems very appropriate to me

Reviews.Title: Good computer for the price.
Reviews.Author: Paula Reymann
Reviews.Content: This was a purchase for someone on a tight budget but in need of a computer that could run windows 8 with a touch screen.  For the money (sale) it is great.  It has bluetooth, HDMI, USB 3 and more.  While there are more powerful computers on the market this does what it needs to do.  The user is very happy with the computer with no complaints.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Angel SanchezCecilio
Reviews.Content: The seller delivered it on time.With respect to the laptop:I have a little problems with the wifi connection. The problem appears when laptop resumes from hibernation.The wifi connection is unstable.Everything else with this laptop is okay, and I love it!

Reviews.Title: A Real Bargain
Reviews.Author: Sand Man
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 is causing some big changes in computing, and this Acer has all the necessary requirements for keeping you informed and in touch with your associates. Compare this V5-471P-6498 to similar  models from other brands and the pricing is an incredible bargain. Even more remarkable considering 14" laptops are highest in demand, often carrying a steeper price than the larger units that have a larger screen and additional components such as a separate number pad.This laptop has the latest 3G components from Intel, is the perfect size mobile and is fully equipped for all-around use by students and for keeping in contact using all the conveniences a multimedia provisioned laptop has to offer. I don't have a single complaint about mine, and am even considering purchasing a second laptop from where I purchased this one -- TigerDirect. As to whether having a backlit keyboard, well that is just a myth. Always check the specs at Acer before purchase, and they listed everything I received with this laptop.

Reviews.Title: v good
Reviews.Author: adam shareef
Reviews.Content: v good easy to use and i love it & i need to buy amzon product i m looking for it?

ProductInfo.Name: Acer Aspire V5-471P-6498 14-Inch Touchscreen Laptop (Silky Silver)
